description.narrative: Basrah Gas Company (BGC) is an Iraqi midstream natural gas company created to gather, treat and process associated gas flared at oil fields in southern Iraq. BGC commenced operations in May 2013 and operates compressor stations, various gas processing plants, a pipeline network and a storage and marine terminal for export. It produces dry gas for sale into the Iraqi gas grid, and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) and condensate for local consumption and export. The project entails the design and installation of a new gas processing plant, the Basrah Natural Gas Liquids (BNGL) facility, part of a broader expansion plan to increase BGCs raw gas processing capacity from 1 billion standard cubic feet per day (bscfd) currently to 1.4 bscfd by 2024.

The project is expected to significantly reduce gas flaring and increase domestic gas production in Iraq, with the potential to deliver significant environmental, economy-wide and stakeholder effects. This includes a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, positive impacts on Iraq's balance of payments and fiscal revenues, and an improvement in energy access and affordability. The project is expected to improve the resilience of Iraq's energy sector by reducing reliance on more polluting energy sources such as high-sulfur fuel oil or crude oil for power generation, and will also reduce the need to import gas. The project also has significant sustainability effects from supporting the country's transition to a lower carbon path.
